SEARCH
Module com.example.nouveau
Package com.example.nouveau

Class Database

java.lang.Object
com.example.nouveau.Database
public class Database extends Object
The class Database manages the persistence of mazes in an SQLite database. It allows the creation of the database and associated tables,the save of a maze, the loading of this later, and the retrieval of the list of saved mazes.

      public Database()

  • Method Details

    • connectDatabase

      public Connection connectDatabase() throws SQLException
      Establish a connection to the SQLite database.
      Returns:
      a Connection instance connected to the database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a connection error occurs.

    • createDatabase

      public void createDatabase()
      Creates the SQLite database if it does not exist. If the database already exists, it does nothing. Print a message to the console indicating success or failure.

    • createTable

      public void createTable()
      Creates the tables Maze and Cell in the database if they do not exist.

    • SaveMaze

      public void SaveMaze(Maze labyrinth, String Name)
      Save a maze in the database.
      Parameters:
      labyrinth - the maze to save.
      Name - the name associated with the maze.

    • DataChargeMaze

      public Maze DataChargeMaze(String Name)
      Charge a maze from the database using its name.
      Parameters:
      Name - the name of the maze to load.
      Returns:
      the corresponding maze, or null if it does not exist.

    • DeleteMaze

      public void DeleteMaze(String Name)

    • getMazeList

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> getMazeList()
      Retrieves the list of names of all mazes saved in the database.
      Returns:
      a list containing the names of the mazes.
